00044 // Too bad we don't have the boost::tuple class.
00045 template <class T1, class T2, class T3> struct triplet
00046 {
00047         typedef T1 first_type;
00048         typedef T2 second_type;
00049         typedef T3 third_type;
00050 
00051         T1 first;
00052         T2 second;
00053         T3 third;
00054         triplet() : first(T1()), second(T2()), third(T3()) {}
00055         triplet(const T1& x, const T2& y, const T3& z) : first(x), second(y), third(z) {}
00056         template <class U, class V, class W>
00057                 triplet (const triplet<U,V,W> &p) : first(p.first), second(p.second), third(p.third) { }
00058 };
00059 
00060 static float percentile(const vector<float> &data, int percentile)
00061 {
00062         if (data.size() == 0)
00063                 return numeric_limits<float>::quiet_NaN();
00064         double dindex = percentile * ((data.size()-1) / 100.0f);
00065         int index = (int) (dindex + 0.5f);
00066         if (abs(dindex - index) <= numeric_limits<float>::epsilon())
00067                 return data[index];
00068         else
00069                 return (data[index-1] + data[index])/2;
00070 }

00074 GenotypeReportEngine * GenotypeReportEngine::FromBase(BaseEngine *engine)
00075 {
00076         if (engine != NULL && engine->getEngineName() == GenotypeReportEngine::EngineName())
00077                 return (GenotypeReportEngine *)engine;
00078         return NULL;
00079 }

00088 void GenotypeReportEngine::defineOptions() {
00089         defineOption("i", "calls-file", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00090                 "Text file specifying genotype calls process.",
00091                 "");
00092         defineOption("s", "sample-out-file", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00093                 "File to write sample results into.",
00094                 "");
00095         defineOption("m", "marker-out-file", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00096                 "File to write marker results into.",
00097                 "");
00098         defineOption("", "call-rate-col", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00099                 "The call rate column header.",
00100                 "Call Rate");
00101         defineOption("", "sample-col", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00102                 "The sample column header.",
00103                 "Sample");
00104         defineOption("", "sample-status-col", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00105                 "The sample status column header.",
00106                 "Sample Status");
00107         defineOption("", "hetfreq-col", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00108                 "The het frequency column header.",
00109                 "Het Freq");
00110         defineOption("", "count-file", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00111                 "Text file specifying counts.",
00112                 "");
00113         defineOption("", "cv-file", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00114                 "Text files specifying cvs. Multiple files should be delimited by ? character.",
00115                 "");
00116         defineOption("", "summaries", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00117                 "Text files specifying the signal summaries. Multiple files should be delimited by ? character.",
00118                 "");
00119         defineOption("", "cv-percentile", PgOpt::INT_OPT,
00120                 "The percentile to report for the CV data.",
00121                 "75");
00122         defineOption("", "signal-percentile", PgOpt::INT_OPT,
00123                 "The percentile to report for the signal data.",
00124                 "50");
00125         defineOption("", "max-marker-het-freq", PgOpt::DOUBLE_OPT,
00126                 "The maximum marker het frequency.",
00127                 "0");
00128         defineOption("", "min-marker-call-rate", PgOpt::DOUBLE_OPT,
00129                 "The minimum marker call rate.",
00130                 "0");
00131         defineOption("", "min-marker-hwp", PgOpt::DOUBLE_OPT,
00132                 "The minimum marker hw p-value.",
00133                 "0");
00134         defineOption("", "min-marker-maf", PgOpt::DOUBLE_OPT,
00135                 "The minimum marker minor allele frequency.",
00136                 "0");
00137         defineOption("", "marker-content-file", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00138                 "Text file specifying the mix file.",
00139                 "");
00140         defineOption("", "type-col", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00141                 "The column name for the type.",
00142                 "Type");
00143         defineOption("", "note-col", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00144                 "The column name for the note.",
00145                 "Note");
00146         defineOption("", "probe-id-col", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00147                 "The column name for the probe id.",
00148                 "Probe Id");
00149         defineOption("", "pass-text", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00150                 "The text to show for markers that pass the threshold test.",
00151                 "Pass");
00152         defineOption("", "fail-text", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00153                 "The text to show for markers that fail the threshold test.",
00154                 "Fail");
00155         defineOption("", "cr-thr-value", PgOpt::DOUBLE_OPT,
00156                 "The call rate threshold.",
00157                 "95.0");
00158         defineOption("", "cr-thr-method", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00159                 "The method to compare the call rate. Can be one of \"lt\", \"gt\", \"le\", \"ge\", \"eq\", \"ne\".",
00160                 "gt");

00162                 "The call rate threshold.",
00163                 "70.0");
00164         defineOption("", "hetfreq-thr-method", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00165                 "The method to compare the call rate. Can be one of \"lt\", \"gt\", \"le\", \"ge\", \"eq\", \"ne\".",
00166                 "lt");
00167         defineOption("", "min-particle-count", PgOpt::INT_OPT,
00168                 "The minimum particle count.",
00169                 "10");

00174 /**
00175  * Make sure that our options are sane. Call Err::errAbort if not.
00176  */
00177 void GenotypeReportEngine::checkOptionsImp()
00178 {
00179         defineStates();
00180         string str = getOpt("sample-out-file");
00181         if (str.empty() == true)
00182                 Err::errAbort("Must specify an output sample summary file.");
00183 
00184         str = getOpt("marker-out-file");
00185         if (str.empty() == true)
00186                 Err::errAbort("Must specify an output marker summary file.");
00187 
00188         str = getOpt("calls-file");
00189         if (str.empty() == true)
00190                 Err::errAbort("Must specify an input calls file.");
00191 
00192         str = getOpt("count-file");
00193         if (str.empty() == true)
00194                 Err::errAbort("Must specify an input count file.");
00195 
00196         str = getOpt("cv-file");
00197         if (str.empty() == true)
00198                 Err::errAbort("Must specify an input cv file.");
00199 
00200         str = getOpt("summaries");
00201         if (str.empty() == true)
00202                 Err::errAbort("Must specify an input summary file.");
00203 
00204         str = getOpt("marker-content-file");
00205         if (str.empty() == true)
00206                 Err::errAbort("Must specify an input marker file.");
00207 
00208         str = getOpt("cr-thr-method");
00209         if (str != "lt" && str != "gt" && str != "le" && str != "ge" && str != "eq" && str != "ne")
00210                 Err::errAbort("The method must be one of {\"lt\", \"gt\", \"le\", \"ge\", \"eq\", \"ne\"}.");
00211 
00212         str = getOpt("hetfreq-thr-method");
00213         if (str != "lt" && str != "gt" && str != "le" && str != "ge" && str != "eq" && str != "ne")
00214                 Err::errAbort("The method must be one of {\"lt\", \"gt\", \"le\", \"ge\", \"eq\", \"ne\"}.");
00215 }

00217 void GenotypeReportEngine::writeHeader(std::ofstream &out)
00218 {
00219         std::vector<std::string> option_names;
00220         getOptionNames(option_names);
00221         std::vector<PgOpt::PgOptType> option_types;
00222         getOptionTypes(option_types);
00223         for (int i = 0; i < option_names.size(); i++) 
00224         {
00225                 switch (option_types[i]) 
00226                 {
00227                 case PgOpt::BOOL_OPT:
00228                         out << "#%" << option_names[i] << "=" << getOptBool(option_names[i]) << endl;
00229                         break;
00230                 case PgOpt::DOUBLE_OPT:
00231                         out << "#%" << option_names[i] << "=" << getOptDouble(option_names[i]) << endl;
00232                         break;
00233                 case PgOpt::INT_OPT:
00234                         out << "#%" << option_names[i] << "=" << getOptInt(option_names[i]) << endl;
00235                         break;
00236                 case PgOpt::STRING_OPT:
00237                         if (getOpt(option_names[i]).empty() == false)
00238                                 out << "#%" << option_names[i] << "=" << getOpt(option_names[i]) << endl;
00239                 }
00240         }
00241 }
00242 
00243 static bool PassThreshold(double callRate, double thr, const string &thrMethod)
00244 {
00245         if (thrMethod == "lt" && callRate < thr)
00246                 return true;
00247         
00248         else if (thrMethod == "gt" && callRate > thr)
00249                 return true;
00250 
00251         else if (thrMethod == "le" && callRate <= thr)
00252                 return true;
00253         
00254         else if (thrMethod == "ge" && callRate >= thr)
00255                 return true;
00256         
00257         else if (thrMethod == "eq" && abs(callRate - thr) <= numeric_limits<double>::epsilon())
00258                 return true;
00259         
00260         else if (thrMethod == "ne" && abs(callRate - thr) > numeric_limits<double>::epsilon())
00261                 return true;
00262 
00263         return false;
00264 }
00265 
00266 map<string, bool> GenotypeReportEngine::CalculateMarkerReport()
00267 {
00268         map<string, bool> passedMarkers;
00269         double callRate;
00270         double hetFreq;
00271         double hwp;
00272         double maf;
00273         double maxMarkerHetFreq = getOptDouble("max-marker-het-freq");
00274         double minMarkerCallRate = getOptDouble("min-marker-call-rate");
00275         double minMarkerHWP = getOptDouble("min-marker-hwp");
00276         double minMarkerMAF = getOptDouble("min-marker-maf");
00277         string pass = getOpt("pass-text");
00278         string fail = getOpt("fail-text");
00279 
00280         // Open the input call file.
00281         affx::TsvFile tsv;
00282         string in_file = getOpt("calls-file");
00283         if(tsv.open(in_file) != TSV_OK)
00284                 Err::errAbort("Couldn't open the file: " + in_file);
00285         tsv.rewind();
00286 
00287         // The first column are the marker names. The
00288         // remaining columns are the genotype calls.
00289         int nsamples = tsv.getColumnCount(0) - 1;
00290         vector<int> calls(nsamples);
00291         string marker;
00292         tsv.bind(0, 0, &marker, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00293         for (int i=0; i<nsamples; i++)
00294                 tsv.bind(0, i+1, &calls[i], TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00295 
00296         // Create the output file for the per marker results
00297         string out_file = getOpt("marker-out-file");
00298         ofstream out(out_file.c_str(), ios::out);
00299         writeHeader(out);
00300         out.setf(ios::fixed, ios::floatfield);
00301         out <<
00302                 "Marker" << "\t" <<
00303                 "Marker Status" << "\t" <<
00304                 "Call Rate" << "\t" <<
00305                 "Het Freq" << "\t" <<
00306                 "MAF" << "\t" <<
00307                 "HW p-value" <<
00308                 endl;
00309 
00310         // Read the data and calculate the per snp metrics.
00311         // The call codes are: -1=NN, 0=AA, 1=AB, 2=BB
00312         while(tsv.nextLevel(0) == TSV_OK)
00313         {
00314                 bool passMaxMarkerHetFreq = true;
00315                 bool passMinMarkerCallRate = true;
00316                 bool passMinMarkerHWP = true;
00317                 bool passMinMarkerMAF = true;
00318                 int aa=0;
00319                 int ab=0;
00320                 int bb=0;
00321                 int nc=0;
00322                 for (int i=0; i<nsamples; i++)
00323                 {
00324                         if (calls[i] == 0)
00325                                 ++aa;
00326                         else if (calls[i] == 1)
00327                                 ++ab;
00328                         else if (calls[i] == 2)
00329                                 ++bb;
00330                         else
00331                                 ++nc;
00332                 }
00333 
00334                 callRate = 100.0f * (aa+ab+bb) / nsamples;
00335                 passMinMarkerCallRate = (callRate >= minMarkerCallRate);
00336 
00337                 if (aa + ab + bb > 0)
00338                 {
00339                         hetFreq = (float) ab / (aa+ab+bb);
00340                         passMaxMarkerHetFreq = (hetFreq <= maxMarkerHetFreq);
00341 
00342                         float freqA = (float)(2*aa + ab) / (2*aa + 2*ab + 2*bb);
00343                         float freqB = (float)(2*bb + ab) / (2*aa + 2*ab + 2*bb);
00344                         maf = min(freqA, freqB);
00345                         passMinMarkerMAF = (maf >= minMarkerMAF);
00346                 }
00347 
00348                 hwp = affxstat::CalcHWEqPValue(aa, ab, bb);
00349                 if (hwp != std::numeric_limits<double>::signaling_NaN() && hwp != std::numeric_limits<double>::quiet_NaN() && hwp != std::numeric_limits<double>::infinity())
00350                         passMinMarkerHWP = (hwp >= minMarkerHWP);
00351 
00352 
00353 
00354                 // Output the marker name.
00355                 out << marker << "\t";
00356 
00357                 // Output the pass/fail status
00358                 if (passMaxMarkerHetFreq && passMinMarkerCallRate && passMinMarkerHWP && passMinMarkerMAF)
00359                 {
00360                         passedMarkers[marker] = true;
00361                         out << pass;
00362                 }
00363                 else
00364                 {
00365                         out << fail + ":";
00366                         if (passMaxMarkerHetFreq == false)
00367                                 out << " HF";
00368                         if (passMinMarkerCallRate == false)
00369                                 out << " CR";
00370                         if (passMinMarkerHWP == false)
00371                                 out << " HWP";
00372                         if (passMinMarkerMAF == false)
00373                                 out << " MAF";
00374                 }
00375                 out << "\t";
00376 
00377                 // Output the call rate and determine if it passes the threshold test
00378                 out.precision(1);
00379                 out << callRate << "\t";
00380 
00381                 // Output the het freq and MAF and determine if it passes the threshold test
00382                 if (aa + ab + bb == 0)
00383                 {
00384                         out << "NaN" << "\t";
00385                         out << "NaN" << "\t";
00386                 }
00387                 else
00388                 {
00389                         out.precision(1);
00390                         out << hetFreq * 100. << "\t";
00391                         out << maf * 100. << "\t";
00392                 }
00393                 
00394                 // Output the HW p-value and determine if it passes the threshold test
00395                 out.precision(6);
00396                 if (hwp == std::numeric_limits<double>::signaling_NaN() || hwp == std::numeric_limits<double>::quiet_NaN() || hwp == std::numeric_limits<double>::infinity())
00397                         out << "NaN";
00398                 else
00399                         out << hwp;
00400 
00401                 out << endl;
00402         }
00403         out.close();
00404         tsv.close();
00405         return passedMarkers;
00406 }
00407 
00408 static vector<string> GetSampleNames(const string& fileName)
00409 {
00410         // Get the sample names from the input file. These are the column names (except the first column).
00411         affx::TsvFile tsv;
00412         if(tsv.open(fileName) != TSV_OK)
00413                 Err::errAbort("Couldn't open the file: " + fileName);
00414         tsv.rewind();
00415         int nsamples = tsv.getColumnCount(0) - 1;
00416         vector<string> samples(nsamples);
00417         for (int i=0; i<nsamples; i++)
00418                 samples[i] = tsv.getColumnName(0, i+1);
00419         tsv.close();
00420         return samples;
00421 }
00422 
00423 static vector<triplet<float, float, float> > CalculateCallRates(const string &fileName, int nsamples, const map<string, bool> &passedMarkers)
00424 {
00425         // Bind to the call columns.
00426         affx::TsvFile tsv;
00427         if(tsv.open(fileName) != TSV_OK)
00428                 Err::errAbort("Couldn't open the file: " + fileName);
00429         tsv.rewind();
00430         string marker;
00431         vector<int> calls(nsamples);
00432         for (int i=0; i<nsamples; i++)
00433                 tsv.bind(0, i+1, &calls[i], TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00434         tsv.bind(0, 0, &marker, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00435 
00436         // Read the data and calculate call counts for each sample.
00437         int rows = 0;
00438         int passedRows = 0;
00439         vector<triplet<float,float,float> > callRates(nsamples);
00440         callRates.assign(nsamples, triplet<float,float,float>(0.0f, 0.0f, 0.0f));
00441         while(tsv.nextLevel(0) == TSV_OK)
00442         {
00443                 ++rows;
00444                 for (int i=0; i<nsamples; i++)
00445                 {
00446                         if (calls[i] != -1)
00447                                 ++callRates[i].first;
00448                         if (calls[i] == 1)
00449                                 ++callRates[i].third;
00450                 }
00451 
00452                 if (passedMarkers.find(marker) != passedMarkers.end())
00453                 {
00454                         ++passedRows;
00455                         for (int i=0; i<nsamples; i++)
00456                         {
00457                                 if (calls[i] != -1)
00458                                         ++callRates[i].second;
00459                         }
00460                 }
00461         }
00462         tsv.close();
00463 
00464         // Calculate the call rates
00465         for (int i=0; i<nsamples; i++)
00466         {
00467                 callRates[i].first = (callRates[i].first * 100.0f) / rows;
00468                 callRates[i].second = (passedRows > 0 ? (callRates[i].second * 100.0f) / passedRows : 0.0f);
00469                 callRates[i].third = (callRates[i].third * 100.0f) / rows;
00470         }
00471 
00472         return callRates;
00473 }
00474 
00475 static vector<float> CalculatePercentileReportedCV(const string &fileName, const string &countFile, int nsamples, int cvPercentile, vector<string>& signalColumns)
00476 {
00477         // Open the count file
00478         affx::TsvFile countTsv;
00479         if(countTsv.open(countFile) != TSV_OK)
00480                 Err::errAbort("Couldn't open the file: " + countFile);
00481         countTsv.rewind();
00482         vector<int> count(nsamples);
00483         for (int i=0; i<nsamples; i++)
00484                 countTsv.bind(0, i+1, &count[i], TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00485 
00486         vector<float> sampleCV(nsamples);
00487         vector<vector<float> > sampleCVs(nsamples);
00488 
00489         vector<string> cvfiles = StringUtils::Split(fileName, "?");
00490 
00491         for (vector<string>::iterator ii = cvfiles.begin(); ii != cvfiles.end(); ++ii)
00492         {
00493                 // Read all of the CV's into a vector, one per sample
00494                 affx::TsvFile tsv;
00495                 if(tsv.open(*ii) != TSV_OK)
00496                         Err::errAbort("Couldn't open the file: " + *ii);
00497 
00498                 string val;
00499                 tsv.headersBegin();
00500                 if (tsv.headersFindNext("signal-column", val) == TSV_OK)
00501                 {
00502                         signalColumns.push_back(val);
00503                 }
00504                 else
00505                 {
00506                         signalColumns.push_back("");
00507                 }
00508                 tsv.rewind();
00509                 for (int i=0; i<nsamples; i++)
00510                         tsv.bind(0, i+1, &sampleCV[i], TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00511                 int rows = 0;
00512 
00513                 countTsv.rewind();
00514 
00515                 // Collect the CV's into a vector, one per sample.
00516                 // This assumes that the marker order in the cv file is the same as the counts file.
00517                 while(tsv.nextLevel(0) == TSV_OK)
00518                 {
00519                         countTsv.nextLevel(0);
00520                         ++rows;
00521                         for (int i=0; i<nsamples; i++)
00522                         {
00523                                 if (count[i] > 0)
00524                                         sampleCVs[i].push_back(sampleCV[i]);
00525                         }
00526                 }
00527                 tsv.close();
00528         }
00529 
00530         countTsv.close();
00531 
00532         // Calculate the CV's for each sample.
00533         sampleCV.assign(nsamples, 0.0f);
00534         for (int i=0; i<nsamples; i++)
00535         {
00536                 if (sampleCVs[i].empty() == false)
00537                 {
00538                         std::sort(sampleCVs[i].begin(), sampleCVs[i].end());
00539                         sampleCV[i] = percentile(sampleCVs[i], cvPercentile);
00540                 }
00541         }
00542 
00543         return sampleCV;
00544 }
00545 
00546 static void CalculatePercentileSignal(const string &signalFileName, const string &countFileName, map<string, bool> controls, int nsamples, int signalPercentile, int minCount, vector<vector<float> > &signalData, vector<vector<float> > &wavg)
00547 {
00548         // Bind the count data
00549         affx::TsvFile countTsv;
00550         if(countTsv.open(countFileName) != TSV_OK)
00551                 Err::errAbort("Couldn't open the file: " + countFileName);
00552         countTsv.rewind();
00553         vector<int> sampleCount(nsamples);
00554         for (int i=0; i<nsamples; i++)
00555                 countTsv.bind(0, i+1, &sampleCount[i], TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00556 
00557         bool firstSignalFile = true;
00558         vector<string> signalfiles = StringUtils::Split(signalFileName, "?");
00559 
00560         vector<float> boundSignalData(nsamples);
00561         signalData.resize(signalfiles.size());
00562         wavg.resize(signalfiles.size());
00563         vector<vector<vector<float> > > sampleSignals(signalfiles.size());
00564         vector<int> wcount(nsamples, 0);
00565 
00566         for (int ichannel = 0; ichannel < signalfiles.size(); ++ichannel)
00567         {
00568                 // Bind the signal data
00569                 affx::TsvFile signalTsv;
00570                 if(signalTsv.open(signalfiles[ichannel]) != TSV_OK)
00571                         Err::errAbort("Couldn't open the file: " + signalfiles[ichannel]);
00572                 signalTsv.rewind();
00573                 string name;
00574                 signalTsv.bind(0, 0, &name, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00575                 for (int i=0; i<nsamples; i++)
00576                         signalTsv.bind(0, i+1, &boundSignalData[i], TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00577 
00578                 countTsv.rewind();
00579 
00580                 sampleSignals[ichannel].resize(nsamples);
00581                 wavg[ichannel].resize(nsamples, 0);
00582 
00583                 // Read the signal and count files and store the signal values and
00584                 // compute the weighted control signals.
00585                 while(signalTsv.nextLevel(0) == TSV_OK)
00586                 {
00587                         countTsv.nextLevel(0);  // moved per Luis 1-22-2010
00588                         for (int i=0; i<nsamples; i++)
00589                         {
00590                                 if (sampleCount[i] >= minCount)
00591                                         sampleSignals[ichannel][i].push_back(boundSignalData[i]);
00592                         }
00593                         if (controls.find(name) != controls.end())
00594                         {
00595                                 for (int i=0; i<nsamples; i++)
00596                                 {
00597                                         if (firstSignalFile == true)
00598                                                 wcount[i] += sampleCount[i];
00599                                         wavg[ichannel][i] += (boundSignalData[i] * sampleCount[i]);
00600                                 }
00601                         }
00602                 }
00603                 firstSignalFile = false;
00604                 signalTsv.close();
00605         }
00606 
00607         countTsv.close();
00608 
00609         // Compute the controls weighted average
00610         for (int ichannel = 0; ichannel < signalfiles.size(); ++ichannel)
00611         {
00612                 for (int i=0; i<nsamples; i++)
00613                         wavg[ichannel][i] = (wcount[i] > 0 ? wavg[ichannel][i] / wcount[i] : std::numeric_limits<float>::quiet_NaN());
00614         }
00615 
00616         // Compute the percentile value for each sample
00617         for (int ichannel = 0; ichannel < signalfiles.size(); ++ichannel)
00618         {
00619                 signalData[ichannel].assign(nsamples, 0.0f);
00620 
00621                 for (int i=0; i<nsamples; i++)
00622                 {
00623                         if (sampleSignals[ichannel][i].empty() == false)
00624                         {
00625                                 std::sort(sampleSignals[ichannel][i].begin(), sampleSignals[ichannel][i].end());
00626                                 signalData[ichannel][i] = percentile(sampleSignals[ichannel][i], signalPercentile);
00627                         }
00628                 }
00629         }
00630 }
00631 
00632 static void CalculateSampleCounts(const string &fileName, int nsamples, vector<float> &medianCodeCount, vector<float> &knownCodeCount, vector<float> &minCodeCount, vector<float> &unknownCodeRate)
00633 {
00634         // Read all of the count's into a vector, one per sample
00635         affx::TsvFile tsv;
00636         if(tsv.open(fileName) != TSV_OK)
00637                 Err::errAbort("Couldn't open the file: " + fileName);
00638         tsv.rewind();
00639 
00640         // Allocate memory for the results
00641         medianCodeCount.resize(nsamples);
00642         medianCodeCount.assign(nsamples, 0);
00643         knownCodeCount.resize(nsamples);
00644         knownCodeCount.assign(nsamples, 0);
00645         minCodeCount.resize(nsamples);
00646         minCodeCount.assign(nsamples, 0);
00647         unknownCodeRate.resize(nsamples);
00648         unknownCodeRate.assign(nsamples, 0);
00649 
00650         // Read the header line for the unknown rates
00651         TsvFileHeaderLine* hdr;
00652         int sampleIdx = 0;
00653         while ((hdr = tsv.nextHeaderPtr()) != NULL)
00654         {
00655                 if (hdr->m_key.find("Unknown Code Rate.") != string::npos)
00656                 {
00657                         unknownCodeRate[sampleIdx++] = atof(hdr->m_value.c_str());
00658                 }
00659         }
00660 
00661         // Get the counts
00662         vector<float> sampleCount(nsamples);
00663         vector<vector<float> > sampleCounts(nsamples);
00664         for (int i=0; i<nsamples; i++)
00665                 tsv.bind(0, i+1, &sampleCount[i], TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00666         int rows = 0;
00667         while(tsv.nextLevel(0) == TSV_OK)
00668         {
00669                 ++rows;
00670                 for (int i=0; i<nsamples; i++)
00671                 {
00672                         sampleCounts[i].push_back(sampleCount[i]);
00673                 }
00674         }
00675         tsv.close();
00676 
00677         // Compute the median, min, and known code counts
00678         for (int i=0; i<nsamples; i++)
00679         {
00680                 std::sort(sampleCounts[i].begin(), sampleCounts[i].end());
00681                 medianCodeCount[i] = percentile(sampleCounts[i], 50);
00682                 minCodeCount[i] = sampleCounts[i][0];
00683                 for (int j=0; j<(int)sampleCounts[i].size(); j++)
00684                         knownCodeCount[i] += sampleCounts[i][j];
00685         }
00686 }
00687 
00688 void GenotypeReportEngine::CalculateSampleReport(const map<string, bool> &passedMarkers)
00689 {
00690         // Get the sample names and metrics
00691         double crThr = getOptDouble("cr-thr-value");
00692         string crThrMethod = getOpt("cr-thr-method");
00693         double hetfreqThr = getOptDouble("hetfreq-thr-value");
00694         string hetfreqThrMethod = getOpt("hetfreq-thr-method");
00695         vector<string> samples = GetSampleNames(getOpt("calls-file"));
00696         int nsamples = (int) samples.size();
00697         vector<triplet<float,float,float> > callRates = CalculateCallRates(getOpt("calls-file"), nsamples, passedMarkers);
00698         vector<string> signalColumns;
00699         map<string, bool> controls = GetControlsFromMixFile();
00700         vector<float> cvData = CalculatePercentileReportedCV(getOpt("cv-file"), getOpt("count-file"), nsamples, getOptInt("cv-percentile"), signalColumns);
00701         vector<vector<float> > signalData;
00702         vector<vector<float> > wavg;
00703         CalculatePercentileSignal(getOpt("summaries"), getOpt("count-file"), controls, nsamples, getOptInt("signal-percentile"), getOptInt("min-particle-count"), signalData, wavg);
00704         vector<float> medianCodeCount;
00705         vector<float> knownCodeCount;
00706         vector<float> minCodeCount;
00707         vector<float> unknownCodeRate;
00708         CalculateSampleCounts(getOpt("count-file"), nsamples, medianCodeCount, knownCodeCount, minCodeCount, unknownCodeRate);
00709 
00710         // Output the metrics to the report file.
00711         // Med Code Signal1: for each sample, median signal value in signals_report (raw, not normalized)
00712         // Known Code Count: for each sample, sum of counts that made it into the count report
00713         // Med Code Count: for each sample, what is the median count across all codes that made it into the count report?
00714         // Min Code Count: for each sample, what is the minimum count across all codes that made it into the count report?
00715         // UQuart Code CV1: for each sample, what is the 75%-ile rank of reported CV values of the first fluorescence channel
00716         string out_file = getOpt("sample-out-file");
00717         ofstream out(out_file.c_str(), ios::out);
00718         writeHeader(out);
00719         out.setf(ios::fixed, ios::floatfield);
00720         out << getOpt("sample-col") <<
00721                 "\t" << "Sample Status" <<
00722                 "\t" << getOpt("call-rate-col") <<
00723                 "\t" << getOpt("call-rate-col") << " (passing markers)" <<
00724                 "\t" << getOpt("hetfreq-col");
00725         
00726         int nchannel = wavg.size();
00727         for (int ichannel = 0; ichannel < nchannel; ++ichannel)
00728         {
00729                 out << "\t" << "Median Sig - Bkgd";
00730                 if (nchannel > 1 && signalColumns[ichannel].empty() == false)
00731                         out << " (" << signalColumns[ichannel] << ")";
00732         }
00733         for (int ichannel = 0; ichannel < nchannel; ++ichannel)
00734         {
00735                 out << "\t" << "Median Code Signal";
00736                 if (nchannel > 1 && signalColumns[ichannel].empty() == false)
00737                         out << " (" << signalColumns[ichannel] << ")";
00738         }
00739         for (int ichannel = 0; ichannel < nchannel; ++ichannel)
00740         {
00741                 out << "\t" << "NegCtrl Signal";
00742                 if (nchannel > 1 && signalColumns[ichannel].empty() == false)
00743                         out << " (" << signalColumns[ichannel] << ")";
00744         }
00745 
00746         out << "\t" << "Known Code Count" <<
00747                 "\t" << "Median Code Count" <<
00748                 "\t" << "Minimum Code Count" <<
00749                 //"\t" << "Upper Quartile Code CV" <<
00750                 "\t" << "Unknown Code Rate" <<
00751                 endl;
00752 
00753         for (int i=0; i<nsamples; i++)
00754         {
00755                 out.precision(1);
00756                 out <<
00757                         samples[i] <<
00758                         "\t" << (PassThreshold(callRates[i].first, crThr, crThrMethod) == true && 
00759                                                                 PassThreshold(callRates[i].third, hetfreqThr, hetfreqThrMethod) == true ? "Pass" : "Fail") <<
00760                         "\t" << callRates[i].first <<
00761                         "\t" << callRates[i].second <<
00762                         "\t" << callRates[i].third;
00763 
00764                 for (int ichannel = 0; ichannel < wavg.size(); ++ichannel)
00765                 {
00766                         if (wavg[ichannel][i] != wavg[ichannel][i])
00767                                 out << "\t" << "NaN";
00768                         else
00769                                 out << "\t" << signalData[ichannel][i] - wavg[ichannel][i];
00770                 }
00771                 for (int ichannel = 0; ichannel < nchannel; ++ichannel)
00772                 {
00773                         out << "\t" << signalData[ichannel][i];
00774                 }
00775                 for (int ichannel = 0; ichannel < nchannel; ++ichannel)
00776                 {
00777                         if (wavg[ichannel][i] != wavg[ichannel][i])
00778                                 out << "\t" << "NaN";
00779                         else
00780                                 out << "\t" << wavg[ichannel][i];
00781                 }
00782                 out.precision(0);
00783                 out <<
00784                         "\t" << knownCodeCount[i] <<
00785                         "\t" << medianCodeCount[i] <<
00786                         "\t" << minCodeCount[i];
00787                 //out.precision(2);
00788                 //out << "\t" << cvData[i];
00789                 out.precision(1);
00790                 out << 
00791                         "\t" << unknownCodeRate[i] <<
00792                         endl;
00793         }
00794         out.close();
00795 }
00796 
00797 /**
00798 * This is the "main()" equivalent of the engine.
00799 */
00800 void GenotypeReportEngine::runImp()
00801 {
00802         map<string, bool> passedMarkers = CalculateMarkerReport();
00803         CalculateSampleReport(passedMarkers);
00804 }
00805 
00806 map<string, bool> GenotypeReportEngine::GetControlsFromMixFile()
00807 {
00808         // Open the mix file and store those negative type entries.
00809         string mixFile = getOpt("marker-content-file");
00810         affx::TsvFile mixTsv;
00811         if(mixTsv.open(mixFile) != TSV_OK)
00812                 Err::errAbort("Couldn't open the file: " + mixFile);
00813         mixTsv.rewind();
00814         map<string, bool> controlMap;
00815         int typeValue;
00816         string note;
00817         string id;
00818         mixTsv.bind(0, getOpt("type-col"), &typeValue, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00819         mixTsv.bind(0, getOpt("note-col"), &note, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00820         mixTsv.bind(0, getOpt("probe-id-col"), &id, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00821         while(mixTsv.nextLevel(0) == TSV_OK)
00822         {
00823                 if (typeValue < 0)
00824                 {
00825                         if (id.empty() == true)
00826                                 id = note;
00827                         controlMap[id] = true;
00828                 }
00829         }
00830         mixTsv.clear();
00831         return controlMap;
00832 }
